DataElement.preferredName: Cancer Treatment Invasive Procedure Tumor Finding Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to to signify whether tumor was present as a result of an invasive procedure associated with cancer treatment, regardless of the purpose of the procedure, and pertaining to diagnostic, therapeutic, exploratory and unknown purpose procedures.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cancer Treatment Invasive Procedure Pathology Finding
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any intervention for management of a malignant neoplasm._Marked by a tendency to spread especially into healthy tissue._An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population.  This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmnetal acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects._The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination._Clinical manifestations that can be either objective when observed by a physician, or subjective when perceived by the patient.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Cancer Treatment Invasive Intervention or Procedure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any intervention for management of a malignant neoplasm.:Marked by a tendency to spread especially into healthy tissue.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population.  This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmnetal acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

Concepts.definition: Any intervention for management of a malignant neoplasm.
Marked by a tendency to spread, especially into healthy surrounding tissue.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

Property.preferredDefinition: A specialty concerned with the nature and cause of disease as expressed by changes in cellular or tissue structure and function caused by the disease process. (MSH98):Clinical manifestations that can be either objective when observed by a physician, or subjective when perceived by the patient.

Concepts.definition: The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.
Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes/ No/ Unknown/ Not Applicable Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Yes, no, unknown or not applicable responses to a question or condition.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

PermissibleValues.origin: LCBCC:Lung Cancer Biomarkers and Chemoprevention Consortium

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

PermissibleValues.origin: LCBCC:Lung Cancer Biomarkers and Chemoprevention Consortium

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was tumor in the optic nerve surgical margin present?

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Duke University adoption of C3D
